awd_abstract_narration: The technique of X-ray crystallography is a powerful tool for                   the determination of the molecular structure of compounds as                    diverse as small polypeptides and complex metal clusters.  When                 combined with the latest computer software, the technique is                    becoming remarkably easy to put into practice.  The acquisition                 of X-ray crystallographic instrumentation markedly improves the                 ability of chemists to carry out frontier research.                                                                                                             The Department of Chemistry at the University of Utah will use                  this award from the Chemistry Shared Instrumentation Program to                 help acquire an X-ray diffractometer.  The new instrumentation                  will be used to enhance the following areas of chemical                         research:                                                                                                                                                       1) Metal-pentadienyl chemistry                                                  2) Mechanistic physical organic chemistry                                       3) Transition metal complexes                                                   4) Ring conformation saturated six-membered rings containing                       phosphorus                                                                   5) Structural, conformational and stereochemical properties of                     organometallic compounds.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
